member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_CREDENTIAL_FIELD_OPTIONS
member.summary: Provides customization options for a single field in a logon or credential UI. Used by and .

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_CREDENTIAL_FIELD_OPTIONS.CPCFO_NONE
member.summary: Default. Don't show the "password reveal" glyph, and use the standard on-screen keyboard layout.

summary.para: Display the "password reveal" glyph in a password entry box. When this glyph is held down by the user, the entry in the password box is shown in plain text. The glyph is shown here:

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_CREDENTIAL_FIELD_OPTIONS.CPCFO_IS_EMAIL_ADDRESS
member.summary: The field will contain an e-mail address. The on-screen keyboard should be optimized for that input (showing the .com and @ keys on the primary keyboard layout). This option is used with Microsoft account credentials.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_CREDENTIAL_FIELD_OPTIONS.CPCFO_ENABLE_TOUCH_KEYBOARD_AUTO_INVOKE
member.summary: When enabled, the touch keyboard will be automatically invoked. This should be set only on the CPFG_CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_LOGO field.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_CREDENTIAL_FIELD_OPTIONS.CPCFO_NUMBERS_ONLY
member.summary: The field will only allow numerals to be entered. The on-screen keyboard should be optimized for that input (showing only a number keypad on the primary keyboard layout). This should be set only on the CPFT_PASSWORD_TEXT field
